com.google.ase.terminal
Class TerminalEmulator

java.lang.Object
  com.google.ase.terminal.TerminalEmulator

 class TerminalEmulator
extends java.lang.Object

Renders text into a screen. Contains all the terminal-specific knowlege and state. Emulates a subset of the X Window System xterm terminal, which in turn is an emulator for a subset of the Digital Equipment Corporation vt100 terminal. Missing functionality: text attributes (bold, underline, reverse video, color) alternate screen cursor key and keypad escape sequences.

Field Detail

mCursorRow

private int mCursorRow
The cursor row. Numbered 0..mRows-1.

mCursorCol

private int mCursorCol
The cursor column. Numbered 0..mColumns-1.

mRows

private int mRows
The number of character rows in the terminal screen.

mColumns

private int mColumns
The number of character columns in the terminal screen.

mTermOut

private final java.io.PrintStream mTermOut
Used to send data to the remote process. Needed to implement the various "report" escape sequences.

mScreen

private final Screen mScreen
Stores the characters that appear on the screen of the emulated terminal.

mArgIndex

private int mArgIndex
Keeps track of the current argument of the current escape sequence. Ranges from 0 to MAX_ESCAPE_PARAMETERS-1. (Typically just 0 or 1.)

MAX_ESCAPE_PARAMETERS

private static final int MAX_ESCAPE_PARAMETERS
The number of parameter arguments. This name comes from the ANSI standard for terminal escape codes.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

mContinueSequence

private boolean mContinueSequence
True if the current escape sequence should continue, false if the current escape sequence should be terminated. Used when parsing a single character.

mEscapeState

private int mEscapeState
The current state of the escape sequence state machine.

mSavedCursorRow

private int mSavedCursorRow
Saved state of the cursor row, Used to implement the save/restore cursor position escape sequences.

mSavedCursorCol

private int mSavedCursorCol
Saved state of the cursor column, Used to implement the save/restore cursor position escape sequences.

K_132_COLUMN_MODE_MASK

private static final int K_132_COLUMN_MODE_MASK
This mask indicates 132-column mode is set. (As opposed to 80-column mode.)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

K_ORIGIN_MODE_MASK

private static final int K_ORIGIN_MODE_MASK
This mask indicates that origin mode is set. (Cursor addressing is relative to the absolute screen size, rather than the currently set top and bottom margins.)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

mDecFlags

private int mDecFlags
Holds multiple DECSET flags. The data is stored this way, rather than in separate booleans, to make it easier to implement the save-and-restore semantics. The various k*ModeMask masks can be used to extract and modify the individual flags current states.

mSavedDecFlags

private int mSavedDecFlags
Saves away a snapshot of the DECSET flags. Used to implement save and restore escape sequences.

mInsertMode

private boolean mInsertMode
True if insert mode (as opposed to replace mode) is active. In insert mode new characters are inserted, pushing existing text to the right.

mTabStops

private boolean[] mTabStops
An array of tab stops. mTabStop[i] is true if there is a tab stop set for column i.

mTopMargin

private int mTopMargin
The top margin of the screen, for scrolling purposes. Ranges from 0 to mRows-2.

mBottomMargin

private int mBottomMargin
The bottom margin of the screen, for scrolling purposes. Ranges from mTopMargin + 2 to mRows. (Defines the first row after the scrolling region.

mAboutToAutoWrap

private boolean mAboutToAutoWrap
True if the next character to be emitted will be automatically wrapped to the next line. Used to disambiguate the case where the cursor is positioned on column mColumns-1.

mProcessedCharCount

private int mProcessedCharCount
Used for debugging, counts how many chars have been processed.

mForeColor

private int mForeColor
Foreground color, 0..7, mask with 8 for bold

mBackColor

private int mBackColor
Background color, 0..7, mask with 8 for underline

mInverseColors

private boolean mInverseColors

mbKeypadApplicationMode

private boolean mbKeypadApplicationMode
Constructor Detail

TerminalEmulator

public TerminalEmulator(Screen screen,
                        int columns,
                        int rows,
                        java.io.PrintStream termOut)
Construct a terminal emulator that uses the supplied screen

Parameters:
screen - the screen to render characters into.
columns - the number of columns to emulate
rows - the number of rows to emulate
termOut - the output file descriptor that talks to the pseudo-tty.
